name: Francis Marion Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were assigned the Francis Marion Hotel on Priceline. When we arrived outside in our car, the Bell staff was slow to react. I had to call them over to get our bags. It seems that at that point, they all came alive. Service was good and the guys were very friendly and helpful afterwards.
reviews.title: With more attention to detail, the Francis Marion could be great!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was small and overfurnished. There was no room to maneuver. The furnishings were dated and the room needs an update. The bed was not comfortably made. The bedding was a scramble mess of sheets, blankets and coverlets that was annoying to the point of keeping us awake.
reviews.title: If you like to walk and or shop, this is a great place to stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bathroom was small and clean with plenty of towels.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel. Top notch service. One of the best We've stayed in.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Foxswamp restaurant food was very good. Only criticism is that the Chef that night used too much salt in the food. Our server at breakfast the next morning seemed not committed to her job and very distant.. We had to continually call her for everything we needed....even for more coffee.
reviews.title: NIce location, good value.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would give the Hotel another chance and would stay there again on my next trip.
reviews.title: If you would stay in a hotel from 1920

reviews.text: My wife and I had a chance to visit the Francis Marion and besides the absolutely beauty of the property, the convenience to everything Charleston and the comfort of the room, the staff were the reason I would come back, again and again. It was like having our own personal tour guide. They were so helpful in letting us know all the things to see and do, were quick with directions. The CVB should be so proud to have you hosting visitors to the city. Nice work!!
reviews.title: Hotel with comfort and your own tour guide

reviews.text: The service here was outstanding! I failed to request an early check-in (had a baby to feed) and the staff went the extra mile to find me a clean room on an extremely busy weekend! The bellhops also open the doors for you as often as they are able which I thought was a nice touch. We were also able to walk everywhere... Great location. Nice rooms. We had a terrific view of Marion Square.
reviews.title: Wonderful service and excellent location!

reviews.text: Located in the center of downtown within walking distance of many great attractions. It is right on King Street, a short walk from some of the best restaurants in the city, and from the famous Market Street area where vendors abound. Service was exceptional and the hotel is a well-maintained older building that still possesses comfortable beds, free WIFI, and a good restaurant. I have to say that the staff was among the best and friendliest I have encountered ... and I'm not a youngster.
reviews.title: Great Character and Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I have been to Charleston many times and we keep coming back to the Francis Marion. We have stayed at other hotels in the historic district but the FM has this old time, historic feel that can't be replicated by big hotel chains in the area. The rooms are quite small, but are perfectly fine for a weekend trip for two. The hotel is located in a prime spot, within walking distance to everything! All in all, a great choice for Charleston!
reviews.title: Best Place to Stay in Charleston

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is definitely an old hotel, but the room was clean, had a flat screen tv and for $165 through priceline, was just fine. But the rooms are configured like an old hotel - small bathoom, no in-room safe, a hodge-podge furniture.
reviews.title: Meh...
Lovely Hotel
reviews.text: I stayed at the Francis Marion Hotel in March for 4 nights while attending a conference in the hotel. This was my second visit to the hotel for a conference. It is a well maintained property in an excellent location near the main shopping area and the College of Charleston. I had a king-bedded room with a sitting area -- couch, club chair and coffee table. The bed was very comfortable with comforter, and choice of pillows in varying levels of softness. In room coffee maker and hair dryer worked well, and the shampoo etc amenities were good quality. Thermostat controlled aircon. Free WIFI, and the desk which includes several electrical outlets.
The public areas are comfortable and inviting with large windows and inviting seating areas. Two computers are available in the lobby.
reviews.title: A real gem!!

reviews.text: The highlight of this hotel for me is the staff. Everyone exudes southern hospitality - a friendly welcome, they remember you by name and are knowledgeable about their city. Joy, the concierge is wonderful. A big help for dinner reservations, recommending restaurants and attractions, and helping you enjoy your visit to the beautiful city.
reviews.title: Nice Location, Nice Hotel, Odd problem

reviews.text: The hotel restaurant is good and reasonably priced, but Charleston has fabulous restaurants so venture out. For breakfast, try the Dixie Supply Bakery at 62 State Street near the public market. It is where the locals go and there is usually a line. It is only open for breakfast and lunch. It is a simple storefront next to a convenience store, but the food is great and made to order.
reviews.title: Excellent, helpful staff

reviews.text: Charleston is a walking city --- bring walking shoes or use the convenient free trolley when you get tired.
reviews.title: Wonderful location;wonderful place to stay.

reviews.text: I picked the Francis Marion Hotel for our 2011 Annual Meeting based on a few things. Location was key being downtown, and having a full service hotel to hold our meetings at. One of the key reasons they got our business though, was they wanted it. Jessica did a fantastic job of staying on top things during my investigative phase. She negotiated on things she could negotiate on and when she couldn't, she was up front about it. I respected that. We are a group of construction guys, and as much as I plan things out, they change, and the hotel was great about being flexible when they could. Service was top notch. Meals were great. The hotel is ancient, but they have done a great job with their updates and there were no complaints on the rooms. Parking is what it is, downtown parking. You have to use the garage next door, but it wasn't as bad as I thought. There were cops all over the place it seemed, so it was totally safe to walk around. Definite thumbs up.
reviews.title: Corporate Meeting Place

reviews.text: Spend a long weekend at the Francis Marion in Charleston, SC. From the moment we pulled up in front of the Hotel the pleasure began. The Bellmen were very helpful with our check-in. The Front Desk was very pleasant and helpful. Our room accommodations were above normal for this type of hotel. Everything was neat and clean. The turn down staff was very kind in the evening with request. The food in the Swamp Fox Restaurant was much better than one of the chain hotels. We liked the property so well that we choose it for our groups function next year. Scored way above the other hotels that we check out in Charleston. Southern Hospitality at it's finest! Thank You, the Francis Marion Staff.
reviews.title: Most Pleasant Stay at this Historic Property

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here while visiting a friend. Location is pretty nice, it's close to alot of restaurants with nice places to shop. Walking distance to everywhere in downtown. Clean and definately has a old city feel to the hotel. Very nice decor and had a good restuarant/bar in the hotel along with a starbucks coffee! So best of both worlds, old world elegance with alot of modern day touches. staff was great as well.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel! great place to stay in Charleston!

reviews.text: I get to Charleston regularly on business and have made the Francis Marion my hotel of choice. Initially I did so because of the convenient parking they have (I usually have a car which is not an asset in Charleston) but now I stay there even when I don't have a car. Its location is perfect, the views I've had from the various rooms in which I've stayed have been glorious (Charleston is called the "Holy city" and when you see all the spires and steeples from your hotel room the point is made clear), and the amenities and staff are tops. This last trip I found myself changing for a formal reception only to discover I left home with no cuff links and a shirt needing them. The concierge directed me to a men's store near the hotel that was still open (and even had a 50% sale going on)--crisis solved. With the College of Charleston only two blocks away, Marion Square just across the street, and lower and upper King right there, if you decide to leave the comfort of your room (it is tempting not to)--everything is at your feet. The Francis Marion is a historic hotel with a successful mix of charm and modern conveniences. The rooms very in size--I've been in both small and in a large suite--and enjoyed them both. The Francis Marion feels like home but is much better because they are doing all the wok for you.
reviews.title: Feeling at home in Charleston
A Great Experience
reviews.text: Although a large hotel, all the comforts and treatment of a small boutique hotel! Staff were wonderful right from our arrival to our departure and the highlight of our visit were our two meals in The Swamp Fox Dining Room. Food was excellent and of good value for the prices. Of greater significance was the attitude and receptiveness of the dining room staff, from the wait staff right up to the manager who moved from table to table making certain that guests were totally satisfied.

description: Experience unsurpassed views of the historic harbor at the Francis Marion Hotel, the only high-rise hotel in Charleston’s historic district. All 234 guest rooms including 10 Suites and 7 Penthouse Suites are tastefully furnished for today’s sophisticated traveler, and provide modern conveniences from wireless Internet access, voicemail and data ports to on-demand movies.
